en: There is nothing to do but apologize.
zh: 除了道歉，别无他法。

en: Don't apologize.
zh: 别道歉。

en: There's no need to apologize.
zh: 没必要道歉。

en: She had the decency to apologize.
zh: 她还算有分寸，道了歉。

en: You don't have to cover your mistake.
zh: 你不必掩盖你的错误。

en: I don't see any reason why I have to apologize.
zh: 我不认为我有任何理由需要道歉。

en: I apologized, but even then she wouldn't speak to me.
zh: 我道歉了，但即使那样她也不肯跟我说话。

en: They talked about nothing but the news in the company.
zh: 他们只谈论公司里的新闻。

en: Smoking in the office is against our rules.
zh: 在办公室吸烟违反我们的规定。

en: The president did not come, but sent the vice-president in his stead.
zh: 总统没来，而是派了副总统代替他。

en: The boss gave us all a day off.
zh: 老板给我们都放了一天假。

en: The boss told his secretary to come up with a good idea by the end of the week.
zh: 老板让他的秘书在周末之前想出一个好主意。

en: The president doesn't see anybody.
zh: 总统不见任何人。

en: The president of the company bribed the government minister.
zh: 公司总裁贿赂了政府部长。

en: The president was sitting in the chair with his back to the window.
zh: 总统背对着窗户坐在椅子上。

en: The president appointed a new manager.
zh: 总统任命了一位新的经理。

en: The company president has hired a headhunter to find us a new sales manager.
zh: 公司总裁聘请了一位猎头来为我们寻找一位新的销售经理。

en: The president instructed the employees to improve their productivity.
zh: 总裁指示员工提高他们的生产力。

en: My boss is twice as old as I am.
zh: 我的老板年纪是我的两倍。

en: I hope my boss agrees to my plan.
zh: 我希望我的老板同意我的计划。

en: My boss says one thing and means another.
zh: 我的老板口是心非。

en: Is the boss in a good mood today?
zh: 老板今天心情好吗？

en: The president held himself responsible for the slump in business, and left his post.
zh: 总裁认为自己应该对生意的衰退负责，并辞去了职务。

en: The president is out now.
zh: 总裁现在不在。

en: The president assembled his advisers for a conference.
zh: 总裁召集了他的顾问们开会。

en: Our boss begrudged us even a small raise in pay.
zh: 我们的老板甚至连小小的加薪都舍不得给我们。

en: The company president was indicted for paying kickbacks.
zh: 公司总裁因支付回扣而被起诉。

en: The boss gave Mike the ax for not coming to work on time.
zh: 老板因为迈克上班迟到而解雇了他。

en: The boss buzzed his secretary.
zh: 老板按铃叫了他的秘书。

en: Where's the president?
zh: 总裁在哪里？

en: Where's the boss?
zh: 老板在哪里？

en: The president gave up the idea because it was not practical.
zh: 总裁放弃了这个想法，因为它不切实际。

en: The boss of our company is always on the go.
zh: 我们公司的老板总是很忙碌。

en: The president was very serious about your overseas assignment.
zh: 总裁对你的海外任务非常重视。

en: It came to the president like a bolt of lightning.
zh: 这件事对总裁来说犹如晴天霹雳。

en: I'll put you through to the president.
zh: 我帮你接通总裁。

en: I am highly honored by the presence of the president.
zh: 总裁的莅临使我感到非常荣幸。

en: After I said such a thing to my boss, I am certain to lose my job.
zh: 我对老板说了那样的话之后，我肯定会丢掉工作。

en: The man talking with our boss is Hiroshi.
zh: 和我们老板说话的那个人是弘志。

en: The president and the secretary talked over a cup of coffee.
zh: 总裁和秘书喝着咖啡交谈。

en: The president and his entourage were injured.
zh: 总裁和他的随行人员受伤了。

en: We are subject to change our plans if the president disagrees.
zh: 如果总裁不同意，我们可能会改变计划。

en: The boss ordered us to work from morning till night.
zh: 老板命令我们从早到晚工作。

en: The news that the president was killed surprised them.
zh: 总裁被杀的消息让他们感到惊讶。

en: The boss praised you for your good work.
zh: 老板称赞你工作做得好。

en: Social securities are not something that should be trifled with.
zh: 社会保障不是可以轻视的事情。

en: Social security? Who do they think they're kidding.
zh: 社会保障？他们以为他们在骗谁呢。

en: The social welfare system is in bad need of renovation.
zh: 社会福利制度亟待改革。

en: The bill was passed by a majority, although the Socialist Party was strongly opposed to it.
zh: 该法案以多数票通过，尽管社会党强烈反对。

en: It is important to eliminate the social unrest.
zh: 消除社会动荡非常重要。

en: Social customs vary greatly from country to country.
zh: 各国的社会习俗差异很大。

en: Social relationships are secondary to this business.
zh: 社会关系在这种生意中是次要的。

en: Progress has been very slow indeed, so far as social life is concerned.
zh: 到目前为止，就社会生活而言，进展非常缓慢。

en: Social conditions are going backward rather than forward.
zh: 社会状况不是在进步，而是在倒退。

en: The social structure has changed beyond recognition.
zh: 社会结构已经变得面目全非。

en: The social structure is not much different.
zh: 社会结构没有太大变化。

en: Some say society should be corrected first, but that is to put the cart before the horse.
zh: 有人说应该先改造社会，但那是本末倒置。

en: Society must do away with laws which cause racial discrimination.
zh: 社会必须废除导致种族歧视的法律。

en: Society consists of individuals.
zh: 社会由个人组成。

en: Society exists for the sake of the individual.
zh: 社会为了个人而存在。

en: Society has a great influence on individuals.
zh: 社会对个人有很大的影响。

en: Society is composed of individuals.
zh: 社会由个人组成。

en: Society could not care less.
zh: 社会根本不在乎。

en: Social customs vary from country to country.
zh: 各国的社会习俗各不相同。

en: We discussed gun control in social studies class.
zh: 我们在社会学课上讨论了枪支管制。

en: A society's values are reflected in its traditions.
zh: 一个社会的价值观反映在其传统中。

en: The impact of science on society is great.
zh: 科学对社会的影响是巨大的。

en: When going out to the society, what is the most necessary knowledge?
zh: 走向社会，什么是最必要的知识？

en: Changes in society come from individuals.
zh: 社会的变化来自个人。

en: When we think of the traditional roles of men and women in society, we think of husbands supporting the family, and wives taking care of the house and children.
zh: 当我们想到男性和女性在社会中的传统角色时，我们想到的是丈夫养家糊口，妻子照顾家庭和孩子。

en: Society and the individual are inseparable.
zh: 社会和个人是不可分割的。

en: Society is built on trust.
zh: 社会建立在信任之上。

en: Working in a society gives women both hardship and achievement, but the daily chores at home don't seem to give them fulfillment.
zh: 在社会上工作给女性带来艰辛和成就，但每天的家务似乎不能给她们带来满足感。

en: Each society has a different institution.
zh: 每个社会都有不同的制度。

en: I would like to put special emphasis on the concept that social ecology is the second school of contemporary environmentalism.
zh: 我想特别强调社会生态学是当代环境主义的第二大学派这一概念。

en: The staff exchanged opinions in the meeting.
zh: 员工们在会议上交流了意见。

en: The employees treat everything the company president says as a golden rule.
zh: 员工们把公司总裁说的一切都奉为金科玉律。

en: Half the office took a day off.
zh: 办公室一半的人请了一天假。

en: The staff exchanged frank opinions in the meeting.
zh: 员工们在会议上坦诚地交流了意见。

en: We'll have our firm's attorneys look through the provisional agreement.
zh: 我们会让公司的律师审查一下临时协议。

en: It is boiled just enough.
zh: 煮得恰到好处。

en: Put the eggs into the boiling water.
zh: 把鸡蛋放进沸水里。

en: I have a bad squint.
zh: 我有点斜视。

en: When one lucky spirit abandons you another picks you up. I just passed an exam for a job.
zh: 当你失去一个幸运之神眷顾时，另一个会来接替。我刚刚通过了一个工作的考试。

en: The area around the melting ice cream was crawling with ants.
zh: 融化的冰淇淋周围爬满了蚂蚁。

en: The policeman was off duty when he was shot to death.
zh: 警察在下班时被枪杀。

en: A photographer took a photograph of my house.
zh: 一位摄影师拍了一张我房子的照片。

en: Don't expose photos to the sun.
zh: 不要将照片暴露在阳光下。

en: Having seen him in the picture, I recognized him at once.
zh: 在照片里见过他，我立刻认出了他。

en: Let's take a picture.
zh: 我们拍张照片吧。

en: My hobby is taking pictures.
zh: 我的爱好是拍照。

en: All you have to do to take a picture is push this button.
zh: 拍照你只需要按这个按钮。

en: You aren't allowed to take photographs.
zh: 你不允许拍照。

en: Let's get our photograph taken.
zh: 我们拍张合影吧。

en: Let's have our picture taken.
zh: 我们拍张照片吧。

en: I enjoy taking pictures.
zh: 我喜欢拍照。

en: Please show me your picture.
zh: 请给我看看你的照片。

en: Nothing is more vivid than a picture.
zh: 没有什么比照片更生动了。

en: Photography is now considered a new form of art.
zh: 摄影现在被认为是一种新的艺术形式。

en: The picture was held on by a pin.
zh: 照片是用别针固定的。

en: Who is that man in the background of the picture?
zh: 照片背景里的那个男人是谁？

en: Do you know this man in the picture?
zh: 你认识照片里的这个人吗？

en: Everybody in the picture is smiling.
zh: 照片里的每个人都在微笑。

en: Can you identify the man using this picture?
zh: 你能用这张照片辨认出这个人吗？

en: Sometimes those photos are not very good.
zh: 有时候那些照片效果不太好。

en: There is insufficient light to take pictures.
zh: 光线不足，无法拍照。

en: Her striped dress accentuates her slimness.
zh: 她那件条纹连衣裙衬托出她的苗条。

en: Keep off the grass.
zh: 请勿践踏草坪。

en: Don't trample on the grass.
zh: 不要践踏草坪。

en: Don't walk on the grass.
zh: 请勿在草坪上行走。

en: I lie on the grass.
zh: 我躺在草地上。

en: Keep off the grass!
zh: 请勿践踏草坪！

en: Let's sit on the grass.
zh: 我们坐在草地上吧。

en: The dog lying on the grass is mine.
zh: 躺在草地上的那只狗是我的。

en: The grass looks nice.
zh: 草坪看起来很漂亮。

en: Get off the lawn!
zh: 离开草坪！

en: Get off the lawn.
zh: 离开草坪。

en: Do you often go to see plays?
zh: 你经常去看戏吗？

en: Did you enjoy yourself at the theater?
zh: 你在剧院玩得开心吗？

en: Was the play interesting?
zh: 那个剧有意思吗？

en: Where can I get tickets to a play?
zh: 我在哪里可以买到戏票？

en: Admission to the show is by ticket only.
zh: 凭票入场。

en: Some lawn equipment is loaded into the jerry-built cart.
zh: 一些草坪设备被装进简陋的手推车里。

en: I wasn't usually home when the lawn was cut, so all I ever saw were the results.
zh: 割草的时候我通常不在家，所以我看到的只是结果。

en: The lawn always looked better on Tuesdays, but I began to notice he wasn't getting as close to the trees as he used to.
zh: 草坪在星期二总是看起来更好，但我开始注意到他不像以前那样靠近树木了。

en: Mr. Kawa made it to the top due to his own abilities, not because of his family.
zh: 川河先生是靠自己的能力登上顶峰的，而不是靠他的家庭。

en: That's my skill talking.
zh: 这是我的实力在说话。

en: Both teams are well matched. The game will be an interesting one.
zh: 两队实力相当，这场比赛会很有意思。

en: Practical utility and artistic beauty combine to make a comfortable house to live in.
zh: 实用性和艺术美相结合，才能建成舒适的住宅。

en: Practice is as important as theory, but we are apt to value the latter and despise the former.
zh: 实践和理论一样重要，但我们往往重视后者而轻视前者。

en: From the practical point of view, his plan is not easy to carry out.
zh: 从实际的角度来看，他的计划不容易实施。

en: From the practical point of view, there are many shortcomings in his plan.
zh: 从实际的角度来看，他的计划有很多缺点。

en: I will tell you exactly how the matter stands.
zh: 我会如实告诉你事情的真相。

en: Being pitched out into life is the best way of learning how to live.
zh: 被抛入生活是学习如何生活的最好方式。

en: Price increases explain the difference between the real and nominal growth rates.
zh: 价格上涨解释了实际增长率和名义增长率之间的差异。

en: Learning probably takes place in virtually every activity in which we take part.
zh: 学习可能发生在几乎我们参与的每一项活动中。

en: In practice, there is little difference between the two.
zh: 实际上，两者之间几乎没有区别。

en: He was as good as his word.
zh: 他言行一致。

en: In fact, he looked silly.
zh: 事实上，他看起来很傻。

en: His failure was in reality due to his lack of care.
zh: 他的失败实际上是由于他的粗心大意。

en: The truth is he has a habit of inventing lies.
zh: 事实是他有编造谎言的习惯。

en: In point of fact it is difficult to foresee the destiny of people.
zh: 事实上，很难预见人们的命运。

en: In fact, I am happy.
zh: 事实上，我很高兴。

en: In fact, I did not know it.
zh: 事实上，我不知道这件事。

en: Actually, I didn't know that.
zh: 实际上，我不知道这件事。

en: You can speak as you actually feel.
zh: 你可以说出你真实的想法。

en: A good idea suddenly struck me.
zh: 我突然有了一个好主意。

en: In fact, he loves her.
zh: 事实上，他爱她。

en: In reality black is not a color; it is the absence of color.
zh: 实际上，黑色不是一种颜色；它是没有颜色。

en: As it is, I am awake.
zh: 事实上，我醒着。

en: As a matter of fact, I think he's a nice guy.
zh: 事实上，我觉得他是个好人。

en: As a matter of fact, I take little notice of girls.
zh: 事实上，我很少注意女生。

en: The actual price was lower than I had thought.
zh: 实际价格比我想象的要低。

en: The actual price was lower than I thought it would be.
zh: 实际价格比我想象的要低。

en: As it is, I can not pay you.
zh: 实际上，我没法付钱给你。

en: As it is, ordinary people cannot afford to purchase such luxuries.
zh: 实际上，普通人买不起这样的奢侈品。

en: As a matter of fact, he knows nothing about it.
zh: 事实上，他对这件事一无所知。

en: As a matter of fact, his lecture was boring.
zh: 事实上，他的讲座很无聊。

en: As a matter of fact, bankruptcy is inevitable.
zh: 事实上，破产是不可避免的。

en: In fact, the opposite is more likely to occur.
zh: 事实上，更有可能发生相反的情况。

en: In fact, this is a major means of bureaucratic control.
zh: 事实上，这是官僚控制的主要手段。

en: As a matter of fact, the owner of this restaurant is a friend of mine.
zh: 事实上，这家餐馆的老板是我的朋友。

en: I really will have to study.
zh: 我真的得学习了。

en: Did you really fly the plane?
zh: 你真的开飞机了吗？

en: Actually, the earth is getting warmer.
zh: 实际上，地球正在变暖。

en: In fact, I was there.
zh: 事实上，我在那里。

en: Through television we can learn various things which we cannot actually see or hear.
zh: 通过电视，我们可以学到各种我们实际上看不到或听不到的东西。

en: What will actually happen is anyone's guess.
zh: 实际上会发生什么，谁也说不准。

en: What'll actually happen is anyone's guess.
zh: 实际上会发生什么，谁也说不准。

en: What actually happened?
zh: 实际上发生了什么？

en: That didn't really happen.
zh: 那并没有真的发生。

en: In point of fact, she had nothing to do with the scandal.
zh: 事实上，她与这丑闻毫无关系。

en: In reality, all they are interested in is power.
zh: 实际上，他们感兴趣的只是权力。

en: In practice, ability counts for more than effort.
zh: 在实践中，能力比努力更重要。

en: Actually, the present method has plenty of room for improvement.
zh: 实际上，目前的方法还有很大的改进空间。

en: In fact, this does not seem to be true at all, except in a very trivial sense.
zh: 事实上，这似乎根本不是真的，除非在非常琐碎的意义上。

en: Actually, this method has plenty of room for improvement.
zh: 实际上，这个方法还有很大的改进空间。

en: The actual cost was higher than the estimate.
zh: 实际成本高于估算成本。

en: These bodies have actually played indispensable roles in attaining these goals.
zh: 实际上，这些机构在实现这些目标方面发挥了不可或缺的作用。

en: Theory is quite useless unless it works in practice.
zh: 如果理论不能在实践中发挥作用，那就毫无用处。

en: In fact, you could do anything you wanted in order to get or keep the ball.
zh: 事实上，为了得到或保住球，你可以做任何你想做的事。

en: Indeed, in some parts of the world we can see the effects already.
zh: 的确，在世界上的某些地方，我们已经可以看到这些影响。

en: Living, as I do, in the country, I seldom have visitors.
zh: 因为我住在乡下，所以我很少有访客。

en: Being tired, as I was, I went to bed earlier than usual.
zh: 因为我很累，所以我比平时睡得早。

en: As it is, you are awake.
zh: 既然如此，你醒着。

en: Even though she is seeing someone else, I won't give her up.
zh: 即使她正在和别人交往，我也不会放弃她。

en: As a matter of fact, he is a man of faith.
zh: 事实上，他是一个有信仰的人。

en: In reality, I used to work like a dog.
zh: 实际上，我以前工作像条狗一样。

en: In fact sleep is vital to us.
zh: 事实上，睡眠对我们至关重要。

en: In fact, the man got angry.
zh: 事实上，那个人生气了。

en: As a matter of fact, I do speak Spanish.
zh: 事实上，我确实会说西班牙语。

en: In fact, gorillas have many of the same feelings that people have.
zh: 事实上，大猩猩和人类有许多相同的情感。

en: Practice must go hand in hand with theory.
zh: 实践必须与理论并驾齐驱。

en: Deeds are better than words.
zh: 行动胜于空谈。

en: Theory without practice will be no use.
zh: 没有实践的理论毫无用处。

en: We found out their plot before they took their actions.
zh: 在他们采取行动之前，我们发现了他们的阴谋。

en: Easier said than done.
zh: 说起来容易做起来难。

en: It is often easier to make plans than to carry them out.
zh: 制定计划通常比执行计划更容易。

en: Something is wrong with the experimental apparatus.
zh: 实验装置出了问题。

en: There must be a defect in the experimental method.
zh: 实验方法一定有缺陷。

en: The results should be measurable and the process repeatable.
zh: 结果应该是可衡量的，过程应该是可重复的。

en: Experiments will enable you to find out what is wrong.
zh: 实验能让你找出哪里出了问题。

en: The experiment was successful.
zh: 实验成功了。

en: The experiment succeeded.
zh: 实验成功了。

en: The experiment ended in failure.
zh: 实验以失败告终。

en: The experiment failed in the initial stages.
zh: 实验在初期阶段就失败了。

en: The whole experiment was recorded on film.
zh: 整个实验都被录制成电影。

en: The results of the experiment were not as we had hoped.
zh: 实验结果不如我们所期望的。

en: The results of the experiment were highly satisfactory.
zh: 实验结果非常令人满意。

en: Experiments are carried out in a laboratory.
zh: 实验是在实验室里进行的。

en: Proper clothes count for much in business.
zh: 得体的着装在商业中很重要。

en: The businessman was leading too busy a life to spend weekends with his family.
zh: 这位商人生活太忙碌，没时间和家人一起度周末。

en: As a businessman he is far above me.
zh: 作为商人，他比我强多了。

en: Tell me about your successes in business.
zh: 告诉我你在商业上的成功之处。

en: To tell the truth, she is my cousin.
zh: 说实话，她是我表妹。

en: To tell the truth, I don't want to go with them.
zh: 说实话，我不想和他们一起去。

en: To tell the truth, she is my sister.
zh: 说实话，她是我姐姐。

en: To tell the truth, I hate the very sight of him.
zh: 说实话，我一看到他就讨厌。

en: I have nothing to lose.
zh: 我没有什么可失去的。

en: I won't lose anything.
zh: 我不会失去任何东西。

en: Owing to a change of administrations, he lost his job.
zh: 由于政府换届，他失去了工作。

en: The scolded boy was sobbing.
zh: 挨骂的男孩在抽泣。

en: A turkey is a little bigger than a chicken.
zh: 火鸡比鸡大一点。

en: Have a happy Turkey day.
zh: 感恩节快乐。

en: After an absence of seven years, I went home.
zh: 离开七年后，我回家了。

en: At seven-thirty, we too closed the door behind us.
zh: 七点半，我们也关上了身后的门。

en: It was seven thirty.
zh: 当时是七点半。

en: It is waiting in the park at 7 o'clock.
zh: 它在公园等候，时间是七点。

en: I go to school at seven.
zh: 我七点上学。

en: Preparations for the ceremony are under way.
zh: 仪式的准备工作正在进行中。

en: The result of this experiment is obscured by the extra variables added in the formula.
zh: 由于公式中添加了额外的变量，这个实验的结果变得模糊不清。

en: The ceremony was followed by the reception.
zh: 仪式之后是招待会。

en: Are you going to attend ceremony?
zh: 你要参加典礼吗？

en: The tanker was launched after the ceremony.
zh: 油轮在仪式后下水。

en: I've never visited Kagoshima, but I intend to this summer.
zh: 我从未去过鹿儿岛，但我打算今年夏天去。

en: Deer are good game.
zh: 鹿是很好的猎物。

en: The deer slept on a bed of leaves.
zh: 鹿睡在落叶堆上。

en: A deer ran for its life.
zh: 一只鹿为了活命而奔跑。

en: The deer ran for its life.
zh: 一只鹿为了活命而奔跑。

en: Deer were once the main game.
zh: 鹿曾经是主要的猎物。

en: The deer darted off in alarm.
zh: 鹿惊慌地跑开了。

en: The deer was running by itself.
zh: 那只鹿独自跑着。

en: The resignations would have little or no effect on upcoming indications.
zh: 这些辞职对即将到来的迹象几乎没有影响。

en: Compiling a dictionary demands an enormous amount of time.
zh: 编纂词典需要大量的时间。

en: Would you please lend me your dictionary?
zh: 请你把你的字典借给我用一下好吗？

en: I left my dictionary downstairs.
zh: 我把我的字典落在楼下了。

en: May I use your dictionary?
zh: 我可以用一下你的字典吗？

en: Try to make the most of your dictionary.
zh: 尽量充分利用你的字典。

en: A dictionary is an excellent reference book.
zh: 字典是一本极好的参考书。

en: Dictionaries are used to look up the words you don't know.
zh: 字典用来查找你不认识的单词。

en: A dictionary defines words.
zh: 字典解释词语。

en: A dictionary is an important aid in language learning.
zh: 字典是语言学习的重要辅助工具。

en: We use a dictionary to look up the meaning of words.
zh: 我们用字典来查找词语的意思。

en: The dictionary is close at hand.
zh: 字典就在手边。

en: It is useless to try to remember all the words in the dictionary.
zh: 试图记住字典里所有的单词是没有用的。

en: What a dictionary says is not always right.
zh: 字典上说的并不总是对的。

en: There are dictionaries and dictionaries.
zh: 字典也分好坏。

en: There's still plenty of room for improvement in dictionaries.
zh: 字典还有很大的改进空间。

en: Talking of dictionaries, I have benefited from various kinds.
zh: 说到字典，我从各种各样的字典中获益匪浅。

en: I'll look up the vocabulary in the dictionary.
zh: 我会在字典里查一下这个词汇。

en: Look it up in your dictionary.
zh: 在你的字典里查一下。

en: Look up the phrase in your dictionary.
zh: 在你的字典里查一下这个短语。

en: If you need a dictionary, I'll lend you an old one that I have.
zh: 如果你需要字典，我可以把我的一本旧的借给你。

en: Without a dictionary, it would be hard to study English.
zh: 没有字典，学英语会很困难。

en: Seeds unsown do not grow.
zh: 不播种，种子就不会生长。

en: No autumn fruit without spring blossom.
zh: 没有春天的花朵，就没有秋天的果实。

en: If you don't plant the seeds, they won't grow.
zh: 如果你不播种，种子就不会生长。

en: You must sow before you can reap.
zh: 必须先播种才能收获。

en: A son who could not learn to paddle his own canoe does not deserve to inherit his father's fortune.
zh: 儿子如果不能学会自立，就不配继承父亲的财产。

en: My father told me to do so on my own.
zh: 我父亲让我自己做的。

en: Could I have three seats in the unreserved section?
zh: 我可以要三张自由席的票吗？

en: The foundation of free nations is democracy.
zh: 自由国家的基础是民主。

en: The rights of the individual are important in a free society.
zh: 在自由社会中，个人权利非常重要。

en: The free market system is endangered.
zh: 自由市场体系正面临危险。

en: I'm prepared to do anything to protect freedom.
zh: 为了保护自由，我愿意做任何事。

en: The road to freedom: hard to climb.
zh: 通往自由的道路：难于攀登。

en: Freedom is so fundamental that its importance cannot be overemphasized.
zh: 自由是如此根本，以至于它的重要性怎么强调都不为过。

en: The Statue of Liberty is a symbol of America.
zh: 自由女神像是美国的象征。

en: The Statue of Liberty is the symbol of America.
zh: 自由女神像是美国的象征。

en: Please help yourself to anything you like.
zh: 请随便享用。

en: May I help myself?
zh: 我可以自便吗？

en: You are free to use this dictionary.
zh: 你可以随意使用这本字典。

en: You are at liberty to state your own views.
zh: 你可以自由地表达你的观点。

en: Express yourself as you please!
zh: 请随意表达你的想法！

en: You are free to use this car.
zh: 你可以随意使用这辆车。

en: Please take one.
zh: 请拿一个。

en: Please take freely.
zh: 请随意拿取。

en: You may spend this money freely.
zh: 你可以随意使用这笔钱。

en: Having lots of free time, I've decided to study French.
zh: 因为有很多空闲时间，我决定学习法语。

en: You must not confuse liberty with license.
zh: 你不能把自由和放纵混淆。

en: There is a great difference between liberty and license.
zh: 自由和放纵之间有很大的区别。

en: Freedom is usually equated with doing whatever you like.
zh: 人们通常把自由等同于为所欲为。

en: Too much liberty spoils all.
zh: 过多的自由会毁掉一切。

en: Freedom is the breath of life.
zh: 自由是生命的呼吸。

en: Freedom is the very essence of our democracy.
zh: 自由是我们民主的真谛。

en: The LDP brought out a bill to raise taxes, but they met with such violent opposition that they backed down.
zh: 自民党提出了一项增税法案，但他们遇到了如此强烈的反对，以至于他们退缩了。

en: The LDP needs a spiritual cleansing.
zh: 自民党需要一次精神上的净化。

en: It may sound like blowing my own horn, but I can speak French.
zh: 这听起来可能像是在自我吹嘘，但我会说法语。

en: I flatter myself that I'm the best golfer in the club.
zh: 我自认为我是俱乐部里最好的高尔夫球手。

en: Never surrender yourself to despair.
zh: 永远不要向绝望屈服。

en: The selfish man was despised by his colleagues.
zh: 这个自私的人被他的同事们鄙视。

en: Little did we imagine finding ourselves in Paris.
zh: 我们万万没想到会发现自己身在巴黎。

en: Don't be ashamed of yourself.
zh: 不要为自己感到羞耻。

en: You should know yourself.
zh: 你应该了解自己。

en: To know oneself is very difficult.
zh: 认识自己是非常困难的。

en: It's very difficult to know yourself.
zh: 了解自己非常困难。

en: To know oneself is difficult.
zh: 认识自己是困难的。

en: You are backing yourself into a bad emotional corner.
zh: 你正在把自己逼入一个糟糕的情感困境。

en: Have confidence in yourself.
zh: 对自己要有信心。

en: I believe in myself and trust what I do.
zh: 我相信自己，并信任我所做的事情。

en: It is our capacity to mold ourselves.
zh: 塑造我们自己的能力。

en: Socrates said that recognising your own ignorance is the first step towards wisdom.
zh: 苏格拉底说，认识到自己的无知是通往智慧的第一步。

en: No man can live for himself.
zh: 没有人可以为自己而活。

en: Imagine a situation where you are all alone.
zh: 想象一下你独自一人的情景。

en: I don't want to let myself go bad.
zh: 我不想让自己变坏。

en: It is difficult to know oneself.
zh: 了解自己是困难的。

en: Respect yourself.
zh: 尊重你自己。

en: Do good to those who hate you.
zh: 要善待那些憎恨你的人。

en: You don't have to kick yourself.
zh: 你不必责备自己。

en: No one likes being thought a fool.
zh: 没有人喜欢被当成傻瓜。

en: Who do you think you are, to look at me like this?
zh: 你以为你是谁，竟然这样看着我？

en: He thinks himself to be somebody.
zh: 他自以为是个人物。

en: Don't sell yourself short.
zh: 别看轻自己。

en: There is no man but loves himself.
zh: 没有人不爱自己。

en: You shouldn't let people make use of you like that.
zh: 你不应该让人那样利用你。

en: You shouldn't let people use you like that.
zh: 你不应该让人那样利用你。

en: She was hurt to find that nobody took any notice of her.
zh: 她很伤心，因为发现没有人注意到她。

en: Don't pick on younger kids.
zh: 不要欺负年纪小的孩子。

en: She maintains her innocence.
zh: 她坚持自己是无辜的。

en: He thought how foolish he had been.
zh: 他想到自己曾经是多么愚蠢。

en: I can do it alone.
zh: 我自己可以做。

en: It's outside my expertise.
zh: 这超出了我的专业范围。

en: He must be crazy to treat his parents like this.
zh: 他这样对待父母，一定是疯了。

en: If you take a close look, you'll find that your friends and you have similar personalities.
zh: 如果你仔细观察，你会发现你和你的朋友们有相似的性格。

en: It's small of you to speak ill of your friends.
zh: 你说你朋友的坏话，真是太小气了。

en: You should be true to your word.
zh: 你应该信守诺言。

en: Read such books as are useful to you.
zh: 读那些对你有用的书。

en: I scarcely believed my eyes.
zh: 我简直不敢相信自己的眼睛。

en: It is crazy of you to put your life at risk.
zh: 你冒着生命危险，真是太疯狂了。

en: I heard my name called from behind me.
zh: 我听到有人在背后叫我的名字。

en: Her eyes ran over the list to see if her name was on it.
zh: 她的目光扫过名单，看看上面有没有她的名字。

en: She didn't think her dream would ever come true.
zh: 她不认为她的梦想会实现。

en: Showing your real feelings is not considered a virtue in Japan.
zh: 在日本，表达真实的感情不被认为是一种美德。

en: Let me pay my share.
zh: 让我来付我那一份。

en: Clean your room.
zh: 打扫你的房间。

en: Clean up your room.
zh: 收拾你的房间。

en: I have to clean my room.
zh: 我必须打扫我的房间。

en: Having put his room in order, he went out.
zh: 整理好房间后，他就出去了。

en: It is hard work to keep my room in proper order.
zh: 要保持我的房间整洁真是一件辛苦的工作。

en: Keep your room as neat as you can.
zh: 尽量保持你的房间整洁。

en: I want to keep my room as neat as possible.
zh: 我想尽可能地保持我的房间整洁。

en: Keep your room neat and tidy.
zh: 保持你的房间干净整洁。

en: I always keep my room as tidy as I can.
zh: 我总是尽可能地保持我的房间整洁。

en: He is reading a book in his room.
zh: 他正在他的房间里看书。

en: Her conceit about her beauty annoyed many people.
zh: 她对自己的美貌的自负惹恼了很多人。

en: You are honest to admit your mistake.
zh: 你很诚实地承认你的错误。

en: One is responsible for one's own words.
zh: 人要为自己的言语负责。

en: Albert is always trying his hand at something to test his own skill.
zh: 阿尔伯特总是尝试做一些事情来测试自己的技能。

en: You must work according to your ability.
zh: 你必须根据你的能力工作。

en: I have much confidence in my ability.
zh: 我对自己的能力很有信心。

en: You must fulfill your duty.
zh: 你必须履行你的职责。

en: Tend to your own affairs.
zh: 管好你自己的事。

en: Having boasted how sure his hunches were, he was forced to eat his hat when he guessed wrong.
zh: 他吹嘘自己的直觉有多么准确，结果猜错了，不得不认栽。

en: I gave my old clothes for the church flea market sale.
zh: 我把我的旧衣服捐给了教堂的跳蚤市场义卖。

en: Many a reader skips the words that he doesn't know.
zh: 很多读者会跳过他们不认识的单词。

en: To stand on your own feet means to be independent.
zh: 自力更生意味着独立自主。

en: Some people live on their sons.
zh: 有些人靠儿子生活。

en: What's in front of you?
zh: 你面前有什么？

en: It is an ill bird that fouls its own nest.
zh: 家丑不可外扬。

en: You have to dig down and pay for it.
zh: 你得深入挖掘并为此付出代价。

en: Do everything at your own risk.
zh: 一切风险自负。

en: Do you ever feel like you're running down?
zh: 你有没有觉得你快要垮掉了？

en: You make your own life.
zh: 你创造你自己的生活。

en: I am thrilled with my new home.
zh: 我对我的新家感到非常兴奋。

en: I'll stand up for what I believe in and won't yield to any threats.
zh: 我会坚持我的信仰，不会屈服于任何威胁。

en: I would rather die than conceal my belief.
zh: 我宁愿死也不隐瞒我的信仰。

en: One should do one's homework by oneself.
zh: 应该自己做作业。

en: I don't want to get my hands dirty.
zh: 我不想弄脏我的手。

en: Who buys tickets to ride in their own motor car?
zh: 谁会买票坐自己的汽车呢？

en: I acted up to my principles.
zh: 我的行为符合我的原则。

en: He came upon an old friend when he visited his club.
zh: 他去俱乐部拜访时，偶然遇到了一位老朋友。

en: Don't blame others for your failure.
zh: 不要把你的失败归咎于他人。

en: Don't accuse others for your own failure.
zh: 不要因为你自己的失败而指责别人。

en: It's no use thinking about one's lost youth.
zh: 思考失去的青春是没用的。

en: Don't leave your things behind.
zh: 不要把你的东西落在后面。

en: Don't leave your stuff behind.
zh: 不要把你的东西落在后面。

en: Don't forget your things.
zh: 不要忘记你的东西。

en: Don't forget your stuff.
zh: 不要忘记你的东西。

en: Put your name on all your belongings.
zh: 在你的所有物品上写上你的名字。

en: Show your own business.
zh: 管好你自己的事。

en: You must be careful of yourself.
zh: 你必须小心自己。

en: I cannot look back on my adolescence without feeling depressed.
zh: 每当我回想起我的青春期，我都会感到沮丧。

en: He will try to have his own way.
zh: 他会试图按自己的方式行事。

en: It is only when you have your own children that you realize the trouble of parenthood.
zh: 只有当你有了自己的孩子，你才会意识到为人父母的麻烦。

en: I had enough to do to look after my own children.
zh: 我照顾自己的孩子已经够忙的了。

en: Do be kind to your children!
zh: 要善待你的孩子们！

en: Don't compare your children with others.
zh: 不要把你的孩子和别人比较。

en: There is no mother that doesn't love her children.
zh: 没有哪个母亲不爱自己的孩子。

en: Look at yourself in the mirror.
zh: 照照镜子看看你自己。

en: If you enjoy the work you do, you have something worth more than money.
zh: 如果你喜欢你所做的工作，你就拥有比金钱更有价值的东西。

en: Do your own work.
zh: 做你自己的工作。

en: It is acceptable to mention your job and interests and to ask the other person about his, but be careful not to let the conversation become too personal.
zh: 可以提及你的工作和兴趣，并询问对方的情况，但要注意不要让谈话变得过于私人。

en: Have you finished your share of the work?
zh: 你完成你那份工作了吗？

en: He didn't really like his job, but he owed money on his new house.
zh: 他其实不喜欢他的工作，但他欠着新房子的贷款。

en: Apply yourself to your own work.
zh: 专心做你自己的工作。

en: Put your heart into your business.
zh: 全心投入你的事业。

en: Do you take pride in your work?
zh: 你为你的工作感到自豪吗？

en: Give yourself to your work with body and soul.
zh: 全身心地投入到你的工作中。

en: I really love my work.
zh: 我真的很喜欢我的工作。

en: It won't do you any good to talk up your own work like that.
zh: 那样吹嘘自己的工作对你没有任何好处。

en: You should make the most of this rare opportunity to demonstrate your talent.
zh: 你应该充分利用这个难得的机会来展示你的才华。

en: You should choose a job in relation to your talents and interests.
zh: 你应该根据你的才能和兴趣选择一份工作。

en: You should harmonize your ambitions with your abilities.
zh: 你应该使你的雄心壮志与你的能力相协调。

en: There is no one but loves his own country.
zh: 没有人不爱自己的国家。

en: You should get acquainted with the history of your own country.
zh: 你应该了解自己国家的历史。

en: He looked upon it as his duty to see to the welfare of the people on his land.
zh: 他认为照顾他土地上的人民的福祉是他的责任。

en: You should be ashamed of your behavior.
zh: 你应该为你的行为感到羞愧。

en: When I think back on what I did, I feel pretty stupid.
zh: 当我回想起我所做的事情时，我觉得自己很蠢。

en: One must be responsible for one's conduct.
zh: 一个人必须为自己的行为负责。

en: Don't press your opinion on me.
zh: 别把你的意见强加于我。

en: It is sometimes very hard to put your idea across.
zh: 有时候很难表达清楚你的想法。

en: It's not good to force our ideas on others.
zh: 把我们的想法强加于人是不好的。

en: Don't intrude your opinions on others.
zh: 不要把你的意见强加于人。

en: I found no shoes completely to my taste.
zh: 我找不到完全合我口味的鞋子。

en: You can do it however you like.
zh: 你可以按你喜欢的方式做。

en: Don't blame others for your own fault.
zh: 不要把自己的错误归咎于他人。

en: It is important to know your own limitations.
zh: 了解自己的局限性很重要。

en: Develop your linguistic competence as much as possible.
zh: 尽可能地提高你的语言能力。

en: It's necessary to make his language like other people's.
zh: 有必要让他的语言习惯和别人一样。

en: You should stick to what you say.
zh: 你应该坚持你所说的话。

en: You should be more sensitive to how people feel about your words.
zh: 你应该对人们对你的话的感受更加敏感。

en: I found it difficult to make myself understood.
zh: 我发现很难让别人理解我。

en: Some people are good at remembering their dreams, others forget theirs.
zh: 有些人擅长记住他们的梦，有些人则会忘记。

en: It goes without saying that those who are awake to their own rights must respect those of others.
zh: 不言而喻，那些意识到自己权利的人必须尊重他人的权利。

en: We must take care of ourselves.
zh: 我们必须照顾好自己。

en: Few people will admit their faults.
zh: 很少有人会承认自己的错误。

en: Few people can realize their faults.
zh: 很少有人能意识到自己的错误。

en: One is apt to forget his own faults.
zh: 人很容易忘记自己的错误。

en: The wearer knows best where the shoe pinches.
zh: 鞋子合不合脚，只有穿的人才知道。

en: I haven't a cent to my name.
zh: 我身无分文。

en: I'm content with my salary.
zh: 我对我的工资很满意。

en: You had better live on your salary.
zh: 你最好靠你的工资生活。

en: To stand in your own feet means to be independent.
zh: 自立意味着独立自主。

en: I cannot describe my feelings.
zh: 我无法描述我的感受。

en: You don't have to hide your feelings.
zh: 你不必隐藏你的感情。

en: As you look at your face, you try to figure out what is happening behind it, in your mind.
zh: 当你看着你的脸时，你试图弄清楚在你的脑海里，你的表情背后发生了什么。

en: Don't cut off your nose to spite your face.
zh: 不要因小失大。

en: It's sometimes difficult to control our feelings.

en: Happy is the man who is contented with his lot.

en: Reflect on what you have done.

en: You ought to answer for what you have done.

en: She knows herself well.

en: He has to burn his fingers to learn.

en: I ride a bike to work.

en: I was thinking that I would go there by bicycle, but it began to rain.
zh: 我本来想骑自行车去那儿的，结果开始下雨了。

en: Some go to school by bicycle, others go by bus.
zh: 有些人骑自行车上学，有些人坐公交车。

zh: 我的自行车轮胎没气了，所以我错过了七点的火车。

zh: 有了自行车，我20分钟就能到你家。

en: His pride would not brook such insults.
zh: 他的骄傲不允许他容忍这样的侮辱。

en: His pride wouldn't allow him to tolerate such insults.
zh: 他的骄傲不允许他容忍这样的侮辱。

zh: 他的自尊心不允许他拿这笔钱。

en: Natural food will do you good.

en: The balance of nature is very fragile.

zh: 一本描述自然奇观的书。

en: Japanese people are fortunate to live in a land with natural hot springs.
zh: 日本人很幸运能生活在一个拥有天然温泉的土地上。

en: The Japanese are fortunate to live on islands with hot springs.

en: It'll cure itself naturally.

en: Nature provides them with the means of survival.

en: You must learn to govern your temper.

en: You should beware of overconfidence.

en: Self-help is the best help.

en: Self-praise is no recommendation.
zh: 自卖自夸没有说服力。

en: Proper praise stinks.
zh: 过分的赞美令人反感。

en: Suicide is a desperate act.
zh: 自杀是一种绝望的行为。

en: We cannot know too much about our own language.
zh: 关于我们自己的语言，我们了解得越多越好。

en: He is a self-oriented person.
zh: 他是一个以自我为中心的人。

en: I'll just introduce myself.
zh: 我来简单介绍一下我自己。

en: May I introduce myself?
zh: 我可以自我介绍一下吗？

en: May I introduce myself to you?
zh: 我可以向您自我介绍一下吗？

en: Would you introduce yourself?
zh: 您能介绍一下您自己吗？

en: Allow me to introduce myself.
zh: 请允许我自我介绍一下。

en: Be your own person and don't imitate others.
zh: 做你自己，不要模仿别人。

en: Don't be overconfident.
zh: 不要过于自信。

en: Keep to your own line.
zh: 坚守自己的路线。

en: When you paint a self-portrait, you sit staring hard at yourself.
zh: 当你画自画像时，你会盯着自己看。

en: This may sound like blowing my own horn, but ...
zh: 这听起来可能像是在自我吹嘘，但是...

en: I prefer to work on my own.
zh: 我更喜欢自己工作。

en: Volunteers collected donations for the benefit of the handicapped.
zh: 志愿者们为残疾人募集捐款。

en: He is digging his own grave.
zh: 他正在自掘坟墓。

en: You should carry out your duty.
zh: 你应该履行你的职责。

en: He grieved over his failures.
zh: 他为自己的失败而悲伤。

en: I hate myself for my own error.
zh: 我讨厌自己犯的错误。

en: Confess himself to be a spy.
zh: 承认自己是间谍。

en: I have a ringing in my ears.
zh: 我耳朵里有耳鸣。

en: My ear is ringing.
zh: 我的耳朵在响。

en: My ears are ringing.
zh: 我的耳朵在响。

en: I hear a noise offensive to the ear.
zh: 我听到一种刺耳的声音。

en: I want the wax cleaned from my ears.
zh: 我想清理我耳朵里的耳垢。

en: Don't buzz about my ears.
zh: 别在我耳边嗡嗡叫。

en: You've told me something.
zh: 你告诉我一些事。

en: I've got an attractive proposition for you.
zh: 我有一个很有吸引力的提议给你。

en: Lend me your ears!
zh: 请听我说！

en: Lend me your ears.
zh: 请听我说！

en: I listened, but I heard nothing.
zh: 我听了，但是什么也没听到。

en: I listened, but I didn't hear anything.
zh: 我听了，但是什么也没听到。

en: I cannot choose but hear.
zh: 我不得不听。

en: I'd like it above my ears.
zh: 我想要它在我的耳朵上面。

en: He was deaf, too.
zh: 他也是个聋子。

en: I listened but couldn't make out what they were saying.
zh: 我听了，但是听不清楚他们在说什么。

en: Would you like your ears to show?
zh: 你想露出你的耳朵吗？

en: Deaf people can talk in sign language.
zh: 聋人可以用手语交流。

en: I often have ear infections.
zh: 我经常耳朵感染。

en: I'm sick of hearing it.
zh: 我听腻了。

en: My ears are frostbitten.
zh: 我的耳朵冻伤了。

en: I have an earache.
zh: 我耳朵疼。

en: My ears burn.
zh: 我的耳朵发烫。

en: My ears feel plugged up.
zh: 我的耳朵感觉堵住了。

en: I have an itch in my ear.
zh: 我的耳朵里发痒。

en: I have an ear infection.
zh: 我耳朵感染了。

en: What do you use to pick wax out of your ears?
zh: 你用什么掏耳朵？

en: I can't remove my earwax.
zh: 我掏不出耳屎。

en: My earwax got very hard.
zh: 我的耳屎变得很硬。

en: A magnet attracts iron.
zh: 磁铁吸引铁。

en: Compass needles point to the north.
zh: 指南针的指针指向北方。

en: I have hemorrhoids.
zh: 我有痔疮。

en: Prevention is better than cure.
zh: 预防胜于治疗。

en: About how much will I have to pay for all the treatments?
zh: 所有治疗大约要花多少钱？

en: It will take a while to go away.
zh: 这需要一段时间才能好。

en: Jiro seems to have missed the train.
zh: 次郎好像错过了火车。

en: Jiro is indifferent about clothing.
zh: 次郎对服装漠不关心。

en: Jiro gave his suit a quick brush.
zh: 次郎迅速地刷了刷他的西装。

en: Jiro made a sketch of Mt. Fuji.
zh: 次郎画了富士山的素描。

en: Jiro advised me on which book to buy.
zh: 次郎建议我买哪本书。

en: Jiro told me which book I should buy.
zh: 次郎告诉我应该买哪本书。

en: Jiro has not come back from New York yet.
zh: 次郎还没有从纽约回来。

en: Jiro could not act otherwise.
zh: 次郎别无选择。

en: Jiro wants to drink Coke.
zh: 次郎想喝可乐。

en: Jiro finds it difficult to make friends with Ken.
zh: 次郎觉得很难和健交朋友。

en: Jiro doesn't have to go to school today.
zh: 次郎今天不必去上学。

en: Jiro communicates with his pen pal in Australia.
zh: 次郎和他在澳大利亚的笔友通信。

en: Come on, Jiro.
zh: 加油，次郎。

en: More and more physicians have begun to use the new medicines.
zh: 越来越多的医生开始使用新药。

en: We can see more and more swallows.
zh: 我们能看到越来越多的燕子。

en: One after another the animals died.
zh: 动物们一个接一个地死去。

en: One event followed another.
zh: 一个事件接着一个事件发生。

en: The next issue will feature articles on divorce.
zh: 下一期将刊登关于离婚的文章。

en: We'll meet next time at ten o'clock, June the first, next year.
zh: 我们下次将于明年六月一日十点见面。

en: Next time bring me that book without fail!
zh: 下次务必把那本书给我带来！

en: I hope to visit Nara next time.
zh: 我希望下次能去奈良。

en: Would you mind coming earlier next time?
zh: 下次能不能早点来？

en: Do a better job next time.
zh: 下次做好一点。

en: Try and do better next time.
zh: 下次尽量做好一点。

en: Next time phone ahead.
zh: 下次提前打电话。

en: My turn comes next.
zh: 下次轮到我了。

en: It's your turn next.
zh: 下次轮到你了。

en: What am I to do next?
zh: 我下一步该做什么？

en: What should I do next?
zh: 我下一步应该做什么？

en: Let me treat you next time, then.
zh: 那下次我请你吧。

en: I expect to sing better next time.
zh: 我希望下次能唱得更好。

en: Which game shall we play next?
zh: 我们接下来玩什么游戏？

en: Where would you like to go next?
zh: 你接下来想去哪里？

en: Please show me what to do next.
zh: 请告诉我下一步该怎么做。

en: Better luck next time.
zh: 下次好运。

en: We have a little time before the next train.
zh: 在下一班火车来之前，我们还有一点时间。

en: When shall we get together next?
zh: 我们下次什么时候聚？

en: When should I come again?
zh: 我下次什么时候来？

en: There was a two hour's interval to the next train.
zh: 到下一班火车还有两个小时的间隔。

en: The next train will be less crowded than this one.
zh: 下一班火车会比这趟更不拥挤。

en: Tell me the exact time when the next train will arrive.
zh: 告诉我下一班火车到达的确切时间。

en: Can you come at ten on May second?
zh: 你五月二号十点能来吗？

en: What time does the next train leave for Tokyo?
zh: 下一班去东京的火车几点开？

en: Make another appointment at the front desk.
zh: 在前台再预约一次。

en: He proceeded to the next question.
zh: 他接着回答下一个问题。

en: Next person, please.
zh: 下一位，请。
